intro: Haemodorum interrex, commonly known as the purple-rooted glory-of-the-snow, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It is a member of the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its striking purple roots and clusters of white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and understoreys. Its ornamental value and ecological importance make it a notable species in Australian flora.
